basics.name: Joseph Lannan
basics.summary: Biophysicist investigating the ultrafast contraction of Spirostomum ambiguum. PhD Candidate at NCSU and founder of Koinslot INC, a retro handheld gaming company.

work.company: North Carolina State University, Elting Lab
work.summary: Research on the cytoskeleton of Spirostomum ambiguum, investigating its ultrafast contraction mechanism.
highlights: Advanced imaging techniques including SEM, TEM, Confocal microscopy

work.summary: Co-founded a company producing a nostalgic gaming system for education.
highlights: Received initial funding for education applications

work.summary: Built an audio social media app that reached 1000 beta testers.
Taught physics labs for undergraduate engineering students and worked in tutoring center.
Managed IT systems, programming, web design, electronics, teaching K-12, logistics, and fabrication.

work.company: North Carolina State University, Dougherty Lab
work.summary: Experiments with growing monolayer transistors using vacuum deposition.
highlights: Experience with AFM, Glovebox, spin coaters, vacuum chambers, and lasers

education.area: B.S. in Physics, Minor in Mathematics

references.name: Dr. Mary Elting
references.reference: Principal Investigator, North Carolina State University

references.name: Dr. Daniel Dougherty
references.reference: Principal Investigator, North Carolina State University

publications.name: Fishnet mesh of centrin-Sfi1 drives ultrafast calcium-activated contraction of the giant cell Spirostomum ambiguum
publications.summary: This paper provides a cohesive, multiscale model for the contraction of Spirostomum, investigating how single cells can execute extreme shape changes with potential for advancing cell biophysics.

publications.name: Culture and imaging techniques for the study of the ultrafast giant cell Spirostomum ambiguum
publications.summary: Describes specialized techniques for culturing and imaging the challenging model organism Spirostomum ambiguum.

presentations.name: Fishnet mesh of centrin-Sfi1 drives ultrafast calcium-activated contraction of the giant cell Spirostomum ambiguum
presentations.description: Poster and oral presentation on Spirostomum contraction mechanism

presentations.name: Fishnet mesh of centrin-Sfi1 drives ultrafast calcium-activated contraction of the giant cell Spirostomum ambiguum

presentations.description: General public talk about science for K-12 school teachers
